      • transformRegressor

        protected java.lang.Object transformRegressor(java.lang.Object x,
                                              boolean inverse)
        Transforming independent variable X. In the most general case that each index is an mathematical expression, this method is not focused.
        Parameters:
        x - specified variable X.
        inverse - if true, there is an inverse transformation.
        Returns:
        transformed value of X.

      • calcCoeffsByStatistics

        protected static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> calcCoeffsByStatistics(java.util.List<double[]> xStatistic,
                                                                         java.util.List<double[]> zStatistic)
        Calculating coefficients based on regressors X (statistic X) and response variable Z (statistic Z). Both statistic X and statistic Z contain 1 at first column.
        Parameters:
        xStatistic - regressors X (statistic X).
        zStatistic - response variable Z (statistic Z).
        Returns:
        coefficients based on regressors X (statistic X) and response variable Z (statistic Z). Return null if any error raises.

      • calcCoeffs

        protected static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> calcCoeffs(java.util.List<double[]> X,
                                                             java.util.List<java.lang.Double> z)
        Calculating coefficients based on data matrix and data vector. This method will be improved in the next version.
        Parameters:
        X - specified data matrix.
        z - specified data vector.
        Returns:
        coefficients base on data matrix and data vector. Return null if any error raises.
